Nested Hierarchy.short_description: System where each level contains and transcends lower levels while being contained by higher ones.

Holarchy.short_description: Hierarchy of holons, where each unit is both whole and part simultaneously.

Scalar Hierarchy.short_description: Gradual progression based on magnitude or degree of a quality.

Emanation.short_description: Descending levels proceeding from supreme source, each level derived from above.

Developmental Hierarchy.short_description: Progressive stages of growth or evolution building upon previous levels.

Functional Hierarchy.short_description: Levels organized by role or function within larger system.

Vibrational Hierarchy.short_description: Gradation based on frequency or subtlety of energy or consciousness.

Logical Hierarchy.short_description: Structure based on inclusion relationships and categorical distinctions.

Power Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on distribution and flow of authority or influence.

Value Hierarchy.short_description: Arrangement according to worth, importance, or ethical significance.

Emergent Hierarchy.short_description: Levels arising from complexity of interactions in lower levels.

Fractal Hierarchy.short_description: Self-similar patterns repeating at different scales of organization.

Temporal Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on sequence, duration, or cycles of time.

Causal Hierarchy.short_description: Arrangement based on chains of cause and effect relationships.

Archetypal Hierarchy.short_description: Organization according to primordial patterns or ideal forms.

Taxonomic Hierarchy.short_description: Classification system based on shared characteristics and descent.

Structural Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on physical or conceptual support relationships.

Intensity Hierarchy.short_description: Gradation based on strength or degree of manifestation.

Conceptual Hierarchy.short_description: Organization of ideas from concrete to abstract or general to specific.

Network Hierarchy.short_description: Levels emerging from patterns of connection and relationship.

Cosmic Hierarchy.short_description: Levels of reality from gross material to supreme spiritual principle.

Operational Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on sequence or dependency of processes.

Morphic Hierarchy.short_description: Levels of form and pattern from simple to complex organization.

Integrative Hierarchy.short_description: System where higher levels coordinate and harmonize lower ones.

Resonant Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on harmonic relationships between levels.

Ecological Hierarchy.short_description: Levels of relationship and dependency in living systems.

Developmental Holarchy.short_description: Growth stages where each includes and transcends previous stages.

Symbolic Hierarchy.short_description: Levels of meaning and representation from literal to transcendent.

Evolutionary Hierarchy.short_description: Organization based on sequence of emergence and complexity.

Dimensional Hierarchy.short_description: Progression through levels of spatial or conceptual dimension.
